name: ObjectMirror
comment:
An dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror is a common superinterface of dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror, dart-mirrors.ClassMirror, and dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror that represents their shared functionality.

For the purposes of the mirrors library, these types are all object-like, in that they support method invocation and field access. Real Dart objects are represented by the dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror type.

See dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror, dart-mirrors.ClassMirror, and dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror.

invoke.name: invoke
invoke.comment:
Invokes the named function and returns a mirror on the result.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the member denoted by dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.invoke.memberName, let a1, ..., an be the elements of dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.invoke.positionalArguments let k1, ..., km be the identifiers denoted by the elements of namedArguments.keys and let v1, ..., vm be the elements of namedArguments.values. Then this method will perform the method invocation o.f(a1, ..., an, k1: v1, ..., km: vm) in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise). If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

getField.name: getField
getField.comment:
Invokes a getter and returns a mirror on the result. The getter can be the implicit getter for a field or a user-defined getter method.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the getter denoted by dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.getField.fieldName, Then this method will perform the getter invocation o.f in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise).

If this mirror is an dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror, and dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.getField.fieldName denotes an instance method on its reflectee, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If this mirror is a dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror, and dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.getField.fieldName denotes a top-level method in the corresponding library, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If this mirror is a dart-mirrors.ClassMirror, and dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.getField.fieldName denotes a static method in the corresponding class, the result of the invocation is an instance mirror on a closure corresponding to that method.

If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

setField.name: setField
setField.comment:
Invokes a setter and returns a mirror on the result. The setter may be either the implicit setter for a non-final field or a user-defined setter method.

Let o be the object reflected by this mirror, let f be the simple name of the getter denoted by dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.setField.fieldName, and let a be the object bound to dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.setField.value. Then this method will perform the setter invocation o.f = a in a scope that has access to the private members of o (if o is a class or library) or the private members of the class of o (otherwise). If the invocation returns a result r, this method returns the result of calling reflect. If the invocation causes a compilation error the effect is the same as if a non-reflective compilation error had been encountered. If the invocation throws an exception e (that it does not catch) this method throws e.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
